tracks.text: Lyrics, like a fairy tale
It's a sign the story has reached its end
Like a single passage taken from
A journey that was too long
Of the evil that once cast a shadow
Across this land
And the memories of the short journey
With the hero who defeated it
The story ends
And the hero goes to sleep
Leaving this land with
Days of peace and quiet
The passage of time heartlessly
Makes people forget
Even the tracks left behind by his life
Begin to rust
Just the same
Your words and wishes and courage
Are still inside of me
And they live on
We chose the same path
That's all it was supposed to be
Why is it that at some point
I wanted to understand the reason for
The tears that fall down my cheeks
Even now
If I retrace the journey we walked together
Even though you're not there
I know I'll be able to find it
Right at the end, embarks a new story. Out to learn people in this journey.
Story of our days will go on forever ever ever, as we now walk

A map depicting the Southern Lands, Central Lands, and Northern Lands. Further north are mountains and a black mountain labelled Ende. Text, At the northernmost end of the continent, I arrived at the place that the people of this world call heaven: Aureole, the land where souls rest. Many souls gather there, and I spoke with friends who once fought alongside me. - Flamme, the Legendary Mage

Below a blue sky and green, leafy trees, a horse draws a carriage along a stone-lined road. A white haired elf girl reads from an old book. A blue haired man with a sword, a green haired priest, and a dwarf sit with her.
She sits up
Between trees and over rolling hills, a walled city sits in the distance.
The priest smiles.
The swordsman smiles at her.
The wind rolls like waves across the meadow grasses near the carriage. Light shines through trees, casting shadows on the heroes' faces.
We look up at the clear, blue sky. White text appears, Frieren: Beyond Journey's End.
We walk under a tall, marble archway
Frieren and party walk down the street, lined with crowds. People look out from windows, and confetti flies through the air.
The swordsman waves to the crowd
Townspeople hang out of every window, waving and cheering. The Europen-style buildings are 3 or 4 stories tall, which pastel colors and Tudor-style wood patterns.
Knights ride horses and carry blue flags. A precession follows the heroes party
Doves land on the archway as the heroes proceed.
A castle stands high over the city
The swordsman
The dwarf
At night, fireworks erupt, forming a picture of a knight and mages fighting a giant skeleton. Text, Chapter 6, The Last Battle.
Townspeople dance in the streets and drink at tables.
Children watch a musician play a lute and sing
Children run. Frieren holds up her plate to avoid them.
She eats a ball of fried meat
Heiter holds a mug. His face is red.
Streets throughout the city shine with light.
The party stands on a terrace beneath a full moon.
The king glares
The men nod
A forest path spins and distorts
Heiter stumbles. His face is blue.
A mimic eats her
She eats. A shooting star falls behind her.
She turns. The men look up.
Another
3 4 5 several more stars shoot across the sky, glowing blue. hey leave a trail that glitters for a moment.
The four stare up at the sky, watching stars shoot by and then fade.
They watch the sky, dozens of stars shoot across at once. The city lights glow a warm orange, tinting the horizon purple.
A bridge stretches out from the city entrance across a lake. The bridge is lined in torches. The stars reflect in the lake.
Daytime
Birds land near a fountain in the sleeping city.
Frieren carries luggage. The men follow her and stop as she steps on a stone bridge.
She crosses the bridge. Heiter waves at her back.
Fish swim in a stream
Day turns to night, spring turns to summer to fall to winter, again and again
At night, a campfire crackles. Frieren reads a book depicting a magic circle and a dark horn.
In a shop with herbs and vials, she holds up 3 fingers. The apothecary, a man in his 30s, shakes his head and holds up 4 fingers.

She walks across snow, carrying a long red staff with a crescent at the end. She sits amongst ruins and watches a bird fly. She rises from the ground and glows. Flowers grow around grave stones. She stands in a boat and paddles through a cave. Her staff glows, reflecting off large crystal stelactites.
She pulls on the large leaves of a root plant while rabbits watch.
In the snow, she reads, sitting next to a fishing rod and a small snow man. In a town, she holds her staff, and images dance in the air while townspeople watch.
In a dungeon, a treasure chest mimic chews on her.
She walks along a wooden walk way propped up against the walls of a canyon.
She lies in a bubbling creek.
The apothecary, now with gray hair
Flower garlands stretch across the streets of the capital
Flower pots dot the street, and vines have been painted on the building's faded facades.
A boy chases a goose
Frieren watches the boy catch the goose and carry it to a woman.
She comes to a fork. She looks left under an archway and right down some stairs
A bald, hunched man with a long, white beard walks slowly to her, using a walking stick.
He hands her the black horn, emanating a cloud of shadow
Outside, she holds the horn up. A blue bird descends, takes it, and flies away, leaving a single blue feather.
She watches the bird fly into the clear, blue sky

In a nearby clearing, a bronze statue depicting the heroes' party. Himmel holds a sword high and smiles. To his left, Eisen holds an axe. Behind them, Heiter puts a hand over his heart. Frieren stands behind Himmel, holding her staff and staring blankly.
Himmel looks in the mirror. Frieren knocks.
She sits on the porch and yawns
She looks up as Himmel closes his door
Heiter waves. His hair has grayed and his face has wrinkled. Eigen stands next to him. Himmel and Frieren approach.
They walk down the road, passing rows of leafy vines.
They stare at a sunset between mountains. At night, they talk around a campfire.
In the day, they hide in the bushes as long-legged shadowy creatures walk by.
Eisen charges from the bushes
He leaps and hits a giant, black wolf on the head. It's eyes are the size of a man's head.
Frieren points her staff. A magic circle glows and fires a beam of light. It creates a 15 foot crater in the wolf's back. The wolf collapses and dissipates into ash.
At night, they sit in a field. Below them is a crater turned lake. The water reflects the sky, filled with hundreds of shooting stars, tracing thin white lines across the heavens.
Heiter smiles up. Frieren looks softly.
Himmel stares at the sky, the flickering blue of the stars twinkling in his eye.
His eyes grow wide.
Himmel's room is bare. The streets are still. Holding his sword over his chest, Himmel lies, eyes closed, on a bed of purple flowers.
In a Cathedral, people bow over the casket and place a flower.
Eisen, Heiter, and Frieren stand nearby
People walk forward, holding purple flowers.
She looks down. Himmel's body lies peaceful and still.
She opens her mouth. Church bells ring.
A crowd gathers in a cemetery outside of the city.
Dirt is shoveled over the casket and flowers.
Himmel holds a sword as a giant reptile turns to ash.
Himmel and Heiter carry Frieren and Eisen as they fall through exploding rubble.
They feast at a pub.
They eat bread by campfire
Young Himmel walks away from her and fades to white
Heiter and Eisen reach to her, patting her head and back.
Frieren rolls a silver ring between her fingers.
A carriage readies
Heiter climbs in the carriage, sits back, and rides off.
They walk in opposite directions
She walks along the stone road. Weeds peak between cracks in the rock. The clear, blue sky stretches out before her.
The walls of the capital city sit in the distance beyond rolling hills.
She walks along the stone-lined road. A horse draws a carriage, passing under green, leafy trees.
Text, Episode 1, The Journey's End
Frieren looks up at a gnarled, bare tree
Text, 20 years after the death of Himmel the Hero, on the outskirts of the holy city of Strahl in the central lands.
A girl with shoulder length purple hair holds a basket of mushrooms.
Smoke drifts from a cottage chimney
The girl places 2 steaming cups on the table.
The corners of his mouth turn up
A red bound book
Fern stands at the edge of a cliff. She holds a staff a foot taller than she is.
Fern fires a beam. It travels from the cliff, across the valley, towards a boulder atop a neighboring mountain. The shot fizzles shy of the target.
Lyrics, and you alright
Can you hear me
Trailing along deserted train tracks
Crying excessively
Wanting you to smile
I hold on to memories I'd like to keep fresh
There's something I'd like to tell you
With words more precious than a goodbye
Unremarkable yet special
See, things that couldn't have been
Seen if it weren't for these eyes
why? They begin to overflow
So, if I were to be born again
I would surely choose this place once more
So, if we were to meet again
I'd never let you go, I'd choose the present
Even if no promises were made
Even if I'm lost in days of loneliness
Those tears will be alright, dawn will surely break
I'm whispering our lullaby
for you to come back home
